ARABIC: قَالَ سَلَٰمٌ عَلَيْكَ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِى حَفِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you. He has always honoured me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He answered: "Peace be on you. I will seek forgiveness of my Lord for you. He has been gracious to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Abraham said, "Peace be with you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been gracious to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “Stop it – peace be upon you; I shall seek forgiveness for you from my Lord; indeed He is very kind to me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Ibrahim said: "Peace be on you! I will ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily, He is unto me Hafiyyan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Peace be on you, I will pray to my Lord to forgive you; surely He is ever Affectionate to me:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'Peace be upon thee! I will ask my Lord to forgive thee; surely He is ever gracious to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee. Lo! He was ever gracious unto me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Abraham replied, "Peace be on you: I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness, He has indeed been gracious to me,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Ibrahim said: peace be on thee! anon shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee; verily He is unto me ever so soicitous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘Peace be to you! I shall plead with my Lord to forgive you. Indeed, He is gracious to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "Peace be on you! I will ask Forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily! He is unto me, Ever Most Gracious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Peace be on you' he (Abraham) said, 'I shall call upon my Lord to forgive you, for to me He has been gracious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been Kind to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:47] He said, ‘Peace be to you, from me — in other words, I shall not cause you any harm. I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Truly He is ever gracious to me (hafiyyan, from hafiyyun, meaning bārrun, ‘kind’) answering my prayers. And indeed he [Abraham] fulfilled his above-mentioned promise [as described] in [sūrat] al-Shu‘arā’, And forgive my father [Q. 26:86]; but this was before it became clear to him that he [Abraham’s father] was an enemy of God, as mentioned in [sūrat] Barā’a [Q. 9:114].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Abraham said: (Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee) I will pray to Allah for you. (Lo! He was ever gracious unto me) He knows, if He wants to answer my prayer.
